content.transcript:
Food poisoning bacteria will grow well at room temperature, but most will not grow in a refrigerator operating below 5°C.

No food poisoning bacteria multiply below -2°C, so none will grow in frozen food at -18°C.

However, bacteria can survive freezing and they will start multiplying when the food thaws.
Drag the slider on the thermometer to see what happens to bacteria at different temperatures.

page.statement: Food poisoning bacteria multiply rapidly at room temperature.
Some food poisoning bacteria can multiply at temperatures as low as -2°C or up to 52°C. However, most will not grow in the low temperature conditions of refrigerated food (1°C to 4°C).
No food poisoning bacteria will grow in frozen food (-18°C or below). However, they start multiplying when the food thaws.
